contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active form. Alternate translation: "listen to this warning" or "be wise" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be warned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active form. Alternate translation: "listen to this correction" or "take this correction" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be corrected

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "see how those who hate me oppress me" or "see how badly my enemies treat me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: see how I am oppressed by those who hate me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will not always forget the needy" or "God will remember the needy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For the needy will not always be forgotten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "judge the nations in your presence" or "take the nations into your presence and punish them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may the nations be judged in your sight

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "Yahweh forces the people of other nations to leave his land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the nations are driven out of his land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when people everywhere are praising evil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when evil is exalted among the children of mankind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The troubles of those who seek other gods will increase" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their troubles will be ... gods

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "nothing will take me away from his side" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so I will not be shaken from his right hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the foundations of the mountains also trembled and shook" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the foundations of the mountains also trembled and were shaken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "blazing fire came out of his mouth and ignited coals" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: blazing fire came out of his mouth. Coals were ignited by it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God forced foreigners to bow" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: foreigners were forced to bow

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he is my rock and he should be praised" or "may people praise my rock" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may my rock be praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May people exalt the God of my salvation" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the God of my salvation be exalted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has set me free" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I am set free

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they warn your servant" or "they are a warning for your servant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: by them your servant is warned

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "They" refers to the people who trust in chariots and horses. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will bring them down and make them fall" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will be brought down and fall

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will remove him as king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will not be moved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you did not disappoint them" or "you did not fail them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: were not disappointed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "It is like someone is pouring me out like water" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I am being poured out like water

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Do not let my enemies humiliate me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Do not let me be humiliated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Do not let my enemies humiliate me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: do not let me be humiliated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he helps me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I am helped

contextId.occurrenceNote: God's voice is louder and clearer than all other sounds and noises. It can be heard over other loud sounds such as the sound of the waters. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When Yahweh speaks his voice is louder than the sound of the sea" or "Yahweh shouts louder than the sound of the waters" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The voice of Yahweh is heard over the waters

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "do not let others humiliate me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: never let me be humiliated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Do not let others make me feel ashamed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Do not let me be humiliated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "May someone make these lying lips silent" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May lying lips be silenced

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You have removed me from your presence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I am cut off from your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Yahweh sees as innocent" or "who is not guilty according to Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to whom Yahweh reckons no guilt

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "By using his word, Yahweh made the heavens" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: By the word of Yahweh the heavens were made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This could be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "A large army is not what saves a king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No king is saved by a vast army

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will condemn those who hate the righteous" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Those who hate the righteous will be condemned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. It can also be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will forgive everyone who takes refuge in him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.glQuote: None of those who take refuge in him will be condemned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May Yahweh shame and dishonor those who seek my life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May those who seek my life be shamed and dishonored

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May Yahweh turn back and confound those who plan to harm me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May those who plan to harm me be turned back and confounded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May you clothe with shame and dishonor those who exalt themselves over me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May those who exalt themselves over me be clothed with shame and dishonor

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let us praise Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh be praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will not discover and hate his sin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his sin will not be discovered and be hated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you have knocked them down" or "you have destroyed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are knocked down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated as active. Alternate translation: "Those whom God blesses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Those who are blessed by God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom Yahweh curses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who are cursed by him

contextId.occurrenceNote: These can be stated to show the logical connection and clarify the passive clause. Alternate translation: "If a man lives in a commendable way in Yahweh's sight, Yahweh will establish his steps" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is by Yahweh that a man's steps are established ... commendable in God's sight

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh is the one who enables a man to be successful" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is by Yahweh that a man's steps are established

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh forsake the righteous person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the righteous person abandoned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will protect them forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They are preserved forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to Yahweh judging the righteous man. Alternate translation: "When Yahweh judges him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when he is judged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I could not find him" or "Yahweh had taken him away" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he could not be found

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will end his family line" or "he will not have any descendants" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the future for the wicked man is cut off

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you are able to see all my moans of sorrow" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: my groanings are not hidden from you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one can count all the things you think about us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your thoughts which are about us cannot be numbered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be reordered and stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let those who pursue my life to take it awy be ashamed and completely disappointed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let them be ashamed and completely disappointed who pursue my life to take it away

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be reordered and stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let those who delight in hurting me be turned back and brought to dishonor" or "Please have someone turn back those who delight in hurting me and bring them to dishonor" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let them be turned back and brought to dishonor, those who delight in hurting me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those around us scoff at us and mock us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: scoffed and mocked by those around us

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people consider us to be sheep for the slaughter" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we are considered to be sheep for the slaughter

contextId.occurrenceNote: Her clothing is decorated or embroidered with gold. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "she wears clothing that someone has embroidered with golden thread" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: her clothing is worked with gold

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People will lead her to the king as she wears an embroidered dress" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: She will be led to the king in embroidered dress

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "you" refers to the king. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will bring to you the virgins, her companions who follow her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the virgins, her companions who follow her, will be brought to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active from. Alternate translation: "people are to praise him greatly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: greatly to be praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has appointed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are appointed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "let people capture them because of their pride" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let them be captured in their pride

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active clause. However some versions have different interpretations of this phrase. Alternate translation: "to display against those who carry the bow" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be displayed against those who carry the bow

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "nothing can ever move me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will not be greatly moved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "nothing can move me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will not be moved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we will do what we have promised you that we would do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: our vows will be carried out to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The goodness of your house, your holy temple, will satisfy us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We will be satisfied with the goodness of your house, your holy temple

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "tongue" represents words or speech. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I praised him with my tongue" or "I praised him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: he was praised with my tongue

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people may know your ways on earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your ways may be known on earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "let God chase away his enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let his enemies be scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Please do not allow anyone to put those who wait for you to shame because of me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let not those who hope in you be put to shame because of me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Please do not allow anyone to bring dishonor on those who seek you because of me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let not those who seek you be brought to dishonor because of me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "may God put them to shame and bring disgrace upon them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be ashamed and humiliated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "may God turn them around and make them ashamed for what they have done" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let them be turned back and brought to dishonor

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let everyone praise God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May God be praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how "do not let me be humiliated" is translated in [Psalms 25:2](../025/002.md). Alternate translation: "never let my enemies put me to shame" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let me never be put to shame

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You have supported me from the womb" or "You have taken care of me ever since I came out of my mother's womb" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: By you I have been supported from the womb

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Put them to shame and destroy them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let them be put to shame and destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The abstract nouns "rebuke" and "dishonor" can be stated as verbs. Alternate translation: "may everyone rebuke them, and may no one honor them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: let them be covered with rebuke and dishonor

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for God has put to shame and confused them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for they have been put to shame and are confused

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May they give him the gold of Sheba" or "May he receive the gold of Sheba" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the gold of Sheba be given to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "may God cause him to do good things for people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may people be blessed in him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May people bless Yahweh God, the God of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May Yahweh God, the God of Israel, be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May people bless his glorious name forever" or, treating "name" as a metonym for Yahweh himself, "May people forever know how glorious he is" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: May his glorious name be blessed forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "may his glory fill the whole earth" or "may he fill the whole earth with his glory" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may the whole earth be filled with his glory

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "David, the son of Jesse has finished his prayers" or "This is the last prayer of the David the son of Jesse" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The prayers of David son of Jesse are finished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Your people killed the brave soldiers of their enemies and then took all their possessions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The bravehearted were plundered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the kings of the earth fear him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he is feared by the kings of the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one saw your footprints" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your footprints were not seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "and please save us" or "so that you can save us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and we will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will save us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Its shade covered the mountains, its branches the cedars of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The mountains were covered with its shade, the cedars of God by its branches

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will save us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the God of Jacob decreed it" or "the God of Jacob commanded it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a decree given by the God of Jacob

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I would humiliate them forever" or "I will punish them forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May they be humiliated forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Make them ashamed and terrified forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May they be put to shame and be terrified forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will be ashamed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be put to shame

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People will say about Zion" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Of Zion it will be said

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "truthfulness" can be stated as "you always do what you promise to do." This can also be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The assembly of the holy ones praises you because you always do what you promise to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your truthfulness is praised in the assembly of the holy ones

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The council of the holy ones greatly honors God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He is a God who is greatly honored in the council of the holy ones

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "It" stands for David's throne or power to rule as king. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will cause it to last forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It will be established forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May people praise Yahweh forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Blessed be Yahweh forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Before you formed the mountains" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Before the mountains were formed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Even in our best years we experience trouble and sorrow" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: even our best years are marked by trouble and sorrow

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has decided that he will destroy them completely" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are doomed to eternal destruction

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will scatter all those who do evil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All those who do evil will be scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh has planted them" or "Yahweh takes care of them as if they were trees he had planted" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: They are planted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You have firmly established the world" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The world is firmly established

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will ever move it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it cannot be moved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You established your throne in ancient times" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your throne is established from ancient times

contextId.occurrenceNote: The psalmist speaks of Yahweh's punishing the wicked as if Yahweh were trapping an animal in a pit. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until you dig a pit for the wicked" or "until you destroy the wicked" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: until a pit is dug for the wicked

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh is great. Praise him greatly" or "Yahweh is great, and people should praise him greatly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh is great and is to be praised greatly

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Fear him above all other gods" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He is to be feared above all other gods

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "He also established the world" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The world also is established

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "nothing can shake it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it cannot be shaken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people in all the nations exalt him" or "people in all nations praise him greatly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: he is exalted above all the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will not welcome liars" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: liars will not be welcome

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will write this for future generations" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This will be written for future generations

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom the authorities had sentenced to die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who were condemned to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "what our bodies are like" or "how he formed our bodies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: how we are formed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh provides plenty of rain for his trees" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The trees of Yahweh get plenty of rain

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is Yahweh's spirit that created them. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are created

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Joseph's brothers sold him as a slave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Joseph was sold as a servant

contextId.occurrenceNote: These statements can be restated as active. Alternate translation: "The Egyptians bound his feet in shackles; they put an iron collar around his neck. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: His feet were bound by shackles; on his neck was put an iron collar

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the sacrifices that they offered to the dead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the sacrifices offered to the dead

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People credited it to him as a righteous deed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It was counted to him as a righteous deed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Their deeds defiled them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were defiled by their deeds

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "their enemies caused them to be subject to their authority" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were brought into subjection to their authority

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May people praise Yahweh the God of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May Yahweh, the God of Israel, be praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he made the waves still" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the waves were stilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Their leaders diminished their number and brought them low" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were diminished and brought low

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: Because those you love need rescuing" or "Rescue those you love" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So that those you love may be rescued

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When he is on trial, may the judge find him guilty" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When he is judged, may he be found guilty

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "consider his prayer sinful" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may his prayer be considered sinful

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Cause his children to be cut off" or "Cause his children to die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May his children be cut off

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May you remember the sins of his ancestors, Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May his ancestors' sins be mentioned to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May you not forget the sins that his mother committed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may the sin of his mother not be forgotten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "My accusers ridicule me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I am disdained by my accusers

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "may they be ashamed" or "let them be ashamed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may they be put to shame

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "them" refers to the "works of Yahweh." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all those who desire the works of Yahweh eagerly await them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: eagerly awaited by all those who desire them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that people will always remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that will be remembered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that Yahweh's instructions are unchangeable and will last forever. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He has established them forever" or "They will last forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They are established forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) Yahweh has given his instructions in a faithful and proper manner or 2) his people are to observe Yahweh's instructions in a faithful and proper manner. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for his people to observe them faithfully and properly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be observed faithfully and properly

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will bless the descendants of the godly man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the descendants of the godly man will be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: he will not be troubled or overwhelmed by circumstances for his trust is in Yahweh? This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For nothing will ever move him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For he will never be moved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will remember the righteous person forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the righteous person will be remembered forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will exalt him by giving him honor" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be exalted with honor

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May Yahweh, who made heaven and earth, bless you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May you be blessed by Yahweh, who made heaven and earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I suffer greatly" or "People afflict me very much" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I am greatly afflicted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People hear the joyful shout of victory in the tents of the righteous" or "The righteous shout joyfully for victory in their tents" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The joyful shout of victory is heard in the tents of the righteous

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Before you afflicted me" or "Before you punished me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Before I was afflicted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Put the proud to shame" or "Cause those who are proud to be ashamed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let the proud be put to shame

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I may not be ashamed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I may not be put to shame

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have tested your word many times" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: has been tested very much

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People despise me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I am ... despised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to how people forged the tip of the arrow in a fire. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that he sharpened over burning coals of the broom tree" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: sharpened over burning coals of the broom tree

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase occurs in the passive voice to avoid implying that Yahweh is obligated to bless those who honor him. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will bless everyone who honors him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Blessed is everyone who honors Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated as an active verb. "Yahweh will bless the man who honors him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the man will be blessed who honors Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh is not explicitly mentioned as the one who does these things. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May Yahweh shame them and defeat them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: May they all be put to shame and turned back

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "may God bless the person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may the person be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "Someone will throw their leaders down" or 2) "Their leaders will throw them down." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their leaders will be thrown down

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one can measure his understanding" or "his understanding has no limit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his understanding cannot be measured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he created them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were created
